instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A2159: What is A2159? A2159 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2019 with EMC 3301, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01598..
definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..
definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2159</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Keyboard
threads.message:
i have a macbook pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2159</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> and it needs a keyboard

do you guys know if it uses the same keyboard as the other models

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2159</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Keyboard
threads.message:
As dukefawks mentioned, an Apple keyboard program is available for these machines.
If you didn't work on it yet, run to Apple.

He also said to forget about changing keyboard only:
"Keyboards are crap quality and you need to drill the rivets. It is NOT like the <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> or <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
But for the love of god just get a complete topcase"
